column1: Bandanaira Airport (also known as Banda Neira Airport) (IATA: NDA
column2: ICAO: WAPC) is the airport in the Banda Islands of Maluku
column3: Indonesia and it is one of the smallest airports in the country. The Banda Islands are a popular tourist destination for divers and snorkelers. Most tourists come between February-May and September-December because that is when the weather is the best for snorkeling and diving. Terminal Facilities Bandanaira Airport is a small airport with few basic facilities only. When planes ready to take off or landing
column4: the airport controller will sounds a siren to warn local residents to clear off the runway. The Airport is managed by UPT Ditjen Hubud. The largest aircraft that the runway can handle is a C-212. Public Transportation Local ground transport is available to and from the Bandanaira Airport either from private hire cars or motorcycle taxis called "ojek." Car Park: There are plenty of vehicle parking space within walk distance outside the Airport.
